FeedItems.Title: Deprecating packages on nuget.org
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to announce that nuget.org now supports package deprecation. This has been a long standing ask that will help the ecosystem use supported packages. As a package publisher on nuget.org,...

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Enable using managed identities for KeyVault" (#7840) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[Azure Search] Add ID prefix matching for search" (#7128) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Visual Studio Package Manager UI searches when you pause typing in the search box. Thus, intermediate searches should be pretty good too.

Target queries | Expected results
------------- | -----------------
newton, new, n | Newtonsoft.Json
s | System.*, AWSSDK.S3, Serilog, Swashbuckle
mi, micro | Microsoft.Extensions.\*, Micorsoft.AspNetCore.\*,Microsoft.AspNet.\*,Micrsoft.Owin,Microsoft.\*
en, e, enti, ent | EntityFramework, Microsft.EntityFrameworkCore
m | Moq, System.Memory, Microsoft.*
log4 | log4net
a | AutoMapper, Antlr, AWSSDK.*, Autofac
swash, swa | Swashbuckle.AspNet.Core.Swagger, Swashbuckle, Swashbuckle.*

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Enable auto source code linking on pack" (#9164) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Today its possible to link to source code repository by either manually adding the repository metadata into the `.csproj` or `.nuspec`  file. Or by using `SourceLink` as described in this blog post: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/introducing-source-code-link-for-nuget-packages/

However, it would be great to enable auto source code linking to public repositories, upon `pack`:

Closed issue "SignedPackageIntegrityVerificationTests is disabled for netcore, we need to enable it." (#8918) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
SignedPackageIntegrityVerificationTests is disabled for netcore. 
We need to enable the test and the APIs it depends on, for netcoreapp5.0, to make xplat verification/signing have a better coverage of tests.
